Query.SqlString: SELECT Top 32767 ID,Literature FROM Literature WHERE (Literature ='AAC85')

BibliographicData.Title: Callosal and prefrontal associational projecting cell populations in area 7A of the macaque monkey: a study using retrogradely transported fluorescent dyes.

Reference.Quotation: "Fast blue or true blue (5% solution) was injected into area 7a; nuclear yellow (2% solution) was injected into the prefrontal cortex...In each animal, two sets of dye injections were made; one dye was injected into the posterior parietal cortex and a second dye was injected into the contralateral prefrontal cortex...In case 83A-4 a single dye injection was made into area 7a...In 83A-8 the injection site also included parts of areas 7b and LIP, but in the other two cases the injections were strictly confined to area 7a."

"Fast blue or true blue (5% solution) was injected into area 7a; nuclear yellow (2% solution) was injected into the prefrontal cortex...In each animal, two sets of dye injections were made; one dye was injected into the posterior parietal cortex and a second dye was injected into the contralateral prefrontal cortex...in case 83A-5 three tightly spaced injections were made near the center of area 7a...In 83A-8 the injection site also included parts of areas 7b and LIP, but in the other two cases the injections were strictly confined to area 7a."
Fig. 4: "For the prefrontal sections...each filled triangle represents several fast-blue-labeled neurons that projected to area 7a of the same side."

Fig. 4: "In the drawings of the posterior parietal sections the filled triangles represent fast-blue-labeled neurons that project callosally to 7a..."

"Fast blue or true blue (5% solution) was injected into area 7a; nuclear yellow (2% solution) was injected into the prefrontal cortex...In each animal, two sets of dye injections were made; one dye was injected into the posterior parietal cortex and a second dye was injected into the contralateral prefrontal cortex...in case 83A-8 20 injections were made so as to label almost half of area 7a. In 83A-8 the injection site also included parts of areas 7b and LIP, but in the other two cases the injections were strictly confined to area 7a."

"Fast blue or true blue (5% solution) was injected into area 7a; nuclear yellow (2% solution) was injected into the prefrontal cortex...In each animal, two sets of dye injections were made; one dye was injected into the posterior parietal cortex and a second dye was injected into the contralateral prefrontal cortex...In each case the prefrontal injections included parts of areas 8a, 45, and 46."

"Fast blue or true blue (5% solution) was injected into area 7a; nuclear yellow (2% solution) was injected into the prefrontal cortex...In each animal, two sets of dye injections were made; one dye was injected into the posterior parietal cortex and a second dye was injected into the contralateral prefrontal cortex...In each case the prefrontal injections included parts of areas 8a, 45, and 46."

"Fast blue or true blue (5% solution) was injected into area 7a; nuclear yellow (2% solution) was injected into the prefrontal cortex...In each animal, two sets of dye injections were made; one dye was injected into the posterior parietal cortex and a second dye was injected into the contralateral prefrontal cortex...In each case the prefrontal injections included parts of areas 8a, 45, and 46."
"In other experiments, we made single injections of...labeled amino acids (nine cases) in different parts of area 7a..."

"In other experiments, in which we made single injections of...labeled amino acids (nine cases) in different parts of area 7a, we always found that the heaviest labeling on the opposite site was in a region corresponding to the principal focus of the injection."
